plan_metadata.title: Arxos Software Development Plan - Critical Gaps Resolution

executive_summary.current_status: Solid foundation with critical architectural and feature gaps identified
strengths: Comprehensive testing and security (100% coverage for critical components)
Enterprise-grade architecture with Clean Architecture and DDD patterns
critical_gaps: Architectural Refactoring (55+ Python services need consolidation into 12 Go services)
Notification Systems (Need migration to Go backend with real integrations)
Advanced Physics Simulation (Missing structural, fluid, thermal, electrical simulation)
Real-time Collaboration (Missing conflict resolution, version control, presence awareness)
AI Integration Features (Missing AI-powered symbol generation, intelligent suggestions)
VS Code Plugin Development (Missing comprehensive IDE functionality)

gap_analysis_findings.architecture_consistency: Unified Go backend for core business logic

recommendations: Start Architectural Refactoring - Highest priority for system improvement
Complete Notification Systems - Implement Go backend with real integrations
Implement Advanced Physics Simulation - Add structural, fluid, thermal, electrical simulation
Enhance Real-time Collaboration - Add conflict resolution and version control
Develop AI Integration Features - Add machine learning and intelligent suggestions
Complete VS Code Plugin - Add comprehensive IDE functionality

architectural_issues.problem: 55+ Python services need consolidation into 12 Go services

notification_systems.problem: Python notification services need Go backend migration
notification_systems.solution: Implement Go notification services with real integrations

physics_simulation.solution: Implement structural, fluid, thermal, electrical simulation

realtime_collaboration.solution: Add conflict resolution, version control, presence awareness

ai_integration.solution: Implement AI-powered symbol generation and intelligent suggestions

vscode_plugin.solution: Add syntax highlighting, IntelliSense, debugging support

phase_1.title: Architectural Refactoring
phase_1.description: Consolidate 55+ Python services into 12 Go services

phase_2.title: Advanced Features Implementation
phase_2.description: Implement advanced notification, physics, and collaboration features
deliverables: Complete notification systems with real integrations
Advanced physics simulation (structural, fluid, thermal, electrical)
Enhanced real-time collaboration with conflict resolution

phase_3.title: AI and Advanced Features
phase_3.description: Implement AI integration and VS Code plugin
deliverables: AI-powered symbol generation and intelligent suggestions
Complete VS Code plugin with debugging support

components.title: CAD Components Implementation
components.impact: Core differentiator for SVGX Engine - cannot achieve CAD-parity without this

components.title: Advanced Export Features
success_criteria: IFC export with complete BIM support

missing_features.name: Fluid Dynamics
requirements: Fluid flow through pipes and ducts
Pressure drop and flow rate calculations

details: End-to-end tests for critical user journeys

api_design.description: Well-structured but some endpoints need completion

database.description: Robust but some advanced features pending

deliverables: Grid and Snap System (Professional CAD snapping)
Complete Notification Systems (Email, Slack, SMS, Webhook)
CMMS Integration (Data sync, work orders, maintenance)
Advanced Physics Simulation (Structural, fluid, thermal, electrical)
Real-time Collaboration (Multi-user, conflict resolution, version control)
VS Code Plugin (Syntax highlighting, IntelliSense, debugging)

cad_complexity.risk: CAD components are complex and may require significant development time
mitigation: Start with core precision and constraint systems
Use proven CAD algorithms and libraries

performance_impact.risk: Advanced features may impact system performance
mitigation: Use efficient algorithms and data structures

integration_complexity.risk: External system integrations may be complex

scope_creep.risk: Feature scope may expand during development

resource_constraints.risk: Limited development resources may impact timeline

testing_coverage.risk: New features may reduce overall test coverage

code_quality.risk: Rapid development may impact code quality

overall_success.description: Achieve CAD-parity status with comprehensive enterprise features

notification_systems_refactoring.title: Notification Systems Go Refactoring Plan
notification_systems_refactoring.description: Comprehensive refactoring plan to move notification services from Python to Go backend for better architecture, performance, and maintainability
notification_systems_refactoring.rationale: Notification services are core business logic that should be centralized in the Go backend rather than distributed across Python services. This improves architecture consistency, performance, and maintainability.
current_issues: Inconsistent architecture with core backend in Go
Duplicate functionality between Python and Go notification handlers
Performance overhead of Python services for core business logic
Maintenance complexity with multiple notification implementations

tasks.name: Create Go Notification Models
tasks.description: Extend existing models.go with comprehensive notification structures

tasks.name: Create Go Notification Service
tasks.description: Implement core notification service in Go
features: SMTP email integration with connection pooling
Slack webhook integration with rate limiting
SMS provider abstraction (Twilio, AWS SNS, Custom)

tasks.name: Create Go Notification Handlers
tasks.description: Implement HTTP handlers for notification API

tasks.name: Create Notification Database Schema
tasks.description: Add notification tables to database migrations

tasks.name: Integrate with Existing Models
tasks.description: Connect notification system with existing MaintenanceNotification model
integration: Add notification preferences to User model

tasks.name: Create Notification Repository
tasks.description: Implement data access layer for notifications

tasks.name: Update Python Services
tasks.description: Modify Python services to call Go notification API
changes: Replace Python notification services with HTTP client
Update monitoring service to use Go notifications

tasks.name: Create Python Notification Client
tasks.description: Implement Python client for Go notification API
features: HTTP client for Go notification API

tasks.name: Update Test Suites
tasks.description: Update tests to use Go notification service

tasks.name: Remove Python Notification Services
tasks.description: Clean up Python notification implementation

tasks.name: Performance Optimization
tasks.description: Optimize Go notification service performance

tasks.name: Monitoring and Observability
tasks.description: Add comprehensive monitoring for notification service

benefits: Improved architecture consistency with Go backend
Better performance with Go's concurrency and efficiency
Better type safety and compile-time error checking
Better integration with existing Go monitoring and logging
success_criteria: All notification functionality moved to Go backend
Python services successfully integrated with Go API

comprehensive_refactoring_assessment.title: Comprehensive Codebase Refactoring Assessment
comprehensive_refactoring_assessment.description: Detailed analysis of architectural inconsistencies and refactoring requirements across the entire codebase
comprehensive_refactoring_assessment.rationale: Current architecture has significant inconsistencies with core business logic distributed across Python services instead of being centralized in the Go backend. This creates maintenance complexity, performance issues, and architectural inconsistencies.

well_architected_services.assessment: Properly implemented with consistent patterns, good performance, and enterprise-grade architecture

problems: Maintenance overhead with multiple monitoring systems

refactoring_plan.action: Remove Python monitoring, enhance Go monitoring

security_services.issue: 6 different security implementations across Python services

refactoring_plan.action: Remove Python security, create comprehensive Go security

problems: Inconsistent cache strategies and TTL management

refactoring_plan.action: Remove Python caching, enhance Go caching

export_services.issue: Export logic should be in Go backend for consistency
problems: File processing and format conversion belong in backend
Database integration needed for export tracking
User management and permissions handled in backend

refactoring_plan.action: Move export logic to Go backend

bim_services.issue: BIM processing is core business logic
problems: Data validation and transformation belong in backend

refactoring_plan.action: Move BIM logic to Go backend

symbol_services.issue: Symbol management is core business logic
problems: Symbol validation and rendering should be backend

refactoring_plan.action: Move symbol logic to Go backend

problems: WebSocket management should be in backend
User session management and state synchronization

refactoring_plan.action: Move real-time logic to Go backend

database_services.issue: 6 different database and persistence implementations in Python
problems: Inconsistent database patterns and connection management
Performance issues with Python database operations

refactoring_plan.action: Remove Python database services, create comprehensive Go database services

logic_services.issue: 4 different logic and rule engine implementations in Python
problems: Performance issues with complex rule processing in Python
Lack of unified rule versioning and deployment

refactoring_plan.action: Remove Python logic engines, create comprehensive Go logic engine

workflow_services.issue: 2 different workflow automation implementations in Python

refactoring_plan.action: Remove Python workflow services, create comprehensive Go workflow engine

analytics_services.issue: 4 different analytics and performance implementations in Python

refactoring_plan.action: Remove Python analytics services, create comprehensive Go analytics

integration_services.issue: 3 different system integration implementations in Python
problems: Different error handling and retry logic

refactoring_plan.action: Remove Python integration services, create comprehensive Go integration

total_impact.architecture_improvement: Unified architecture for core business logic

architecture_improvements: Consistency: All core services in Go
Maintainability: Single codebase for business logic
Deployment: Simplified deployment with fewer services
technical_advantages: Database Integration: Direct GORM integration with unified transaction management
Logic Engine: High-performance rule evaluation and processing
Workflow Automation: Consistent workflow execution patterns
Analytics: Unified metrics collection and performance monitoring
System Integration: Centralized integration patterns and error handling
operational_benefits: Reduced Complexity: Fewer services to maintain
Easier Debugging: Single language for core logic
Better Performance: Go's efficiency for core services

risks_and_mitigation.mitigation: Training and documentation for Go development

success_criteria: All core business logic moved to Go backend
55+ Python services reduced to 12 Go services
Centralized rule engine and logic processing
